attributes.action: Improve the thermal performance of heritage buildings by changing the glass
attributes.background: I would like the Government to change the existing planning law to allow the use of Vacuum glass which will help reduce energy, prevent heat loss and reduce CO2 emissions.
attributes.additional_details: With global warming and the need to reduce CO2 emissions I want the Government to allow all homeowners the opportunity to change their existing single glazed windows and doors into thermally efficient windows and doors that will save the homeowner’s heating bills and in turn reduce energy costs which will also reduce CO2 emissions

rejection.details:
Under planning law listed building consent will normally be required where a listed building is to be altered in a way that effects its character as a building of special architectural or historic interest, but decisions about granting consent is a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

Historic England has published guidance on the care, repair and upgrading of traditional windows which states that “historic windows of interest should be retained wherever possible using careful matching repair" and that their complete replacement "should be a last resort and is rarely necessary” but, again, decisions about what alterations to grant consent for are a matter for individual planning authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Require water companies in the south east to expand water storage facilities
attributes.background: Bring pressure to bear on Water Authorities in the south east to build new reservoirs to cater for the thousands and thousands of new homes being built in their area.
attributes.additional_details:
Global Warming means less rainfall in autumn and winter in the south east,  resulting in less water being available in the summer. 
Severe water restrictions will become commonplace if Water Authorities do not build more reservoirs to be able to supply water to the thousands and thousands of new homes being built and the heavy demand of water these homes will generate.

rejection.details:
The operations of individual providers of water, sanitation and drainage services are a matter for the private providers of these services, not the Government or House of Commons.

There are already standards of service for customers of water and sewerage companies, which are set by Ofwat, the economic regulator of the water sector in England and Wales: https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/households/supply-and-standards/standards-of-service/

We have published the following related petitions, which you might like to sign:

Stop water company monopoly - Extend competition to the residential water market: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334537

Nationalise water companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548586

attributes.action: Create law that front gardens must comprise of plants
attributes.background: We need a law to protect front gardens from being completely obliterated with man-made materials, ensuring that there are plants in every single one for wildlife. At least one-third of all front gardens should be comprised of plants, be that grass, flowers, shrubs or trees.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there are no laws on how much of a front garden can be left for nature with many now being tarmacked or slabbed over, resulting in less space for wildlife and so diminishing biodiversity. In order to limit global temperature warming and increase insect populations, we need to be utilising this vital space of the front garden to take it back to what it should be - a front garden. We need more plants and trees to act as carbon stores, and more flowers for pollinators.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how to maintain domestic gardens are a matter for the homeowner, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Cut household fuel prices and take gas and electricity into public ownership.
attributes.background: Halt or reverse increases in household gas and electricity charges and renationalise both industries so they can be planned and developed in the interests of the people, society and the planet.
attributes.additional_details: Privatisation of gas and electricity has been a giant rip-off. Increases in energy costs for households, public administration and businesses in April 2022 are chiefly intended to benefit corporate shareholders, pushing millions more people into fuel poverty. Nothing short of state ownership of gas and electricity can ensure that all customers are charged a fair price that also takes into account the need to invest in renewable energy on the massive scale needed to help combat global warming.

attributes.action: New Act to BAN building in flood zones in the UK, and on UK wetlands, by 2023.
attributes.background: To pass a NEW Act of Parliament to BAN building on wetlands OR flood zones, to embrace the water flow for energy, from moving water power, and re-flourish and renew the same area space of wetland that we have previously lost, as close as possible to the original wetlands, to combat global warming.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of the strategy for COP 26 to combat global warming and the  rejuvenation of our failing eco systems. To use renewable energies and go some way to combat fossil fuels. 

To re-introduce the ecological importance of wetlands, creating a place for floater to flow to instead of by damaging peoples habitats and homes. 

By BANNING building in flood zones, recognising the important of that land for our sensitively balanced eco structures.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about loss of wetlands, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We could accept a petition calling on a ban on new developments on wetlands or flood zones, but it's not clear what actions you want the Government to take to "embrace the water flow for energy, from moving water power, and re-flourish and renew the same area space of wetland that we have previously lost".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.additional_details:
A new law should be created to prevent the creation of non-recyclable plastics. All newly created products should be created from recycled plastic.

Unless we take a stand against the production of products that contribute to the demise of this planet we will be responsible for the continuation of Global Warming and the ensuing disasters that occur as a result.

attributes.action: Make published Carbon Footprint a key factor prior to any bilateral trade deals.
attributes.background: Explicitly and transparently publish carbon footprint comparisons of all bilateral trade deals. UK Parliamentarians to debate it and British public made aware of the outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Public knowledge and debate about carbon footprints can help save our planet together. The role of Australian beef in the deal currently under review is an example of no apparent consideration of this being done. UK farmers will be undercut at a high cost - global warming! The carbon footprint of beef production anywhere is extremely high but transporting meat from long distance sources creates a much higher carbon footprint and is extremely detrimental to global warming and climate change.

attributes.action: Organize a environmental conference with Heads of State to restore the Aral Sea.
attributes.background: I want the Government to start talks with climate and marine scientists and Heads of State to take action on Sea Level Rise (SLR) by proposing the construction of a pipeline from the Black Sea to pump sea water to the Aral Sea basin to thus restore the Aral Sea, thereby reducing the effects of SLR.

Once the Aral Sea is restored it will help stabilize global weather patterns and also absorb CO2 from the atmosphere thereby slowing global warming, climate change and SLR.

attributes.action: Act immediately to help combat the climate crisis
attributes.background: The Paris Climate Agreement set a limit of global warming to 1.5°C. We are going to surpass this within the next 19 years and we need to act now. We can only do this by eliminating the burning of all fossil fuels immediately and by bringing action to the large companies that are emitting gases.
attributes.additional_details: The Intergovenmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) has said that "major climate changes [are] inevitable and irreversible". We need to protect humanity from this extinction event. We need to stop it now to give future generations hope. Wildfires are spreading and causing mass destruction along with floods, droughts, melting ice and heatwaves, killing many... and this is just the start. The Government needs to stop passing new projects that could hinder world progress to stop a catastrophe.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the climate crisis, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's therefore not clear if you want all use of fossil fuels to be prohibited immediately, or if you want the Government to do something else.

Introduce charges on carbon emissions to tackle climate crisis and air pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574678

attributes.action: Impose a tax on plastic packaging
attributes.background:
I would like the government to impose a tax on plastic packaging for all industries.
If companies are actively discouraged from using plastic packaging it will encourage them to source sustainable and eco friendly alternatives, something that they are not currently doing with any urgency.
attributes.additional_details:
We are faced with a climate emergency and plastic is playing a huge role in this. We can all do personal things to help change this, but unless large corporations are encouraged to source alternatives to plastic, the change will not be fast enough to reduce the impacts of global warming and the millions of plastic items that end up in our seas each year. 
This tax, just like the charge on carrier bags to the public, could fast track us into the change needed to help solve our climate crisis.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550925

attributes.action: Impose import taxes on clothing imported from low- and middle-income countries.
attributes.background: Fast fashion is destroying the planet and exploiting workers. Fast fashion retailers such as Boohoo and Missguided are contributing to global warming, with synthetic fibre emissions becoming as high as those of fossil fuels. Workers are treated terribly, with very low wages and very long hours.
attributes.additional_details: We are in the midst of a climate emergency, and fast fashion is not helping. Amid the Covid-19 outbreak, fast fashion has slowed down and now is the time to implement changes to slow it down for good. This is important to help our planet, and to help the workers who are exploited by fast fashion companies. It goes against human rights to continue to allow fast fashion to continue at the rate it is at. Implementing import taxes will allow these issues to slow down, helping our planet and workers.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

attributes.action: Preparations for food shortages caused by COVID-19
attributes.background: COVID-19 is changing the worldwide food systems as the readiness of labour is lessened. What preparations have already been made? Shortages and consequences for home produced food, supply, trade, competition, inputs, prices, diet and dietary deficiencies, and production in other sectors worldwide.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the lead times for breeding new crop plant varieties and the predicted effects of global warming on the climates and weathers of the world and other sources of instability. 
To control the damaging effects of COVID-19 on nutrition, dietary deficiencies, starvation, and other effects on health.
To control the damaging effects of food shortages on the economy, UK civil society and international relations.
